intro: Acrostichum fistulosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with a prominent central disk. It thrives in wet, sunny environments and is often found near water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of wetland ecosystems.
